intro: Spermacoce laxa, commonly known as the slender false sandwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce laxa is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
